titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Ernest W. Lefever Papers, 1933-2007
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1998 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Writings, correspondence, interview summaries, notes, printed matter, and photographs, relating to pacifism in World War II, postwar African politics, United Nations intervention in the Congo, nuclear proliferation, American military and police-training aid to foreign countries, the role of religion in public policy, and activities of the Ethics and Public Policy Center.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Ernest W. Lefever papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1973.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

odd.p: Correspondence and some printed material relating to post-World War II relief and prisoners aid, and to the Hoover Institution. Arranged alphabetically by correspondent.

Drafts and printed copies of speeches and writings by Ernest W. Lefever. Includes related correspondence, notes, interviews, reports, reviews, printed and non-printed material, and other miscellany. Arranged chronologically.

did.unittitle: FOREIGN AFFAIRS STAFF, OFFICE OF SENATOR HUBERT H. HUMPHREY, 1959-1960

odd.p: Correspondence, letters, memoranda, reports, speech transcripts, press releases, clippings, printed articles, notes, and miscellany. Includes letters, reports and speeches drafted by Ernest W. Lefever for Senator Humphrey. Arranged alphabetically by subject.

Speeches, memoranda, correspondence, letters, reports, printed articles, clippings, directories, interviews, newsletters, book lists, notes, and reviews relating to the activities of American pacifists during World War II, including YMCA involvement in the rehabilitation of German prisoners-of-war in Europe, 1946-1948, Africa, particularly the revolution in the Congo, 1960-1961, and United Nations efforts to restore order, nuclear proliferation, religion and ethics, the United States International Communications Agency, and United States military and public safety assistance to other countries. Arranged alphabetically by subject.

Drafts and printed copies of Ethics and Public Policy Center publications, drafts of unpublished works, a publication catalog, speeches, conference material, schedules, appointment books, reports, correspondence, minutes, notes, and printed material. Arranged by form.

scopecontent.p: Formerly security-classified records of the U.S. government. Arranged chronologically by date of release by Hoover

did.unittitle: General. Relates to post-World War II relief and prisoners aid, 1945-1948

"Religion at the News Desk," Motive, 1951 Dec. Article and additional material, including letters, mimeographed broadcast transcripts (some co-authored by E. Lefever), schedules, printed articles and memoranda relating to a radio program sponsored by Yale University Divinity School, 1951-1952
You, the Nation and the World. Letters and outline relating to a National Student YMCA-YWCA pamphlet

"Protestants and United States Foreign Policy, 1925-1954: A Study of the Response of National Protestant Leaders to the Issues and Direction of U.S. Foreign Policy and of the Theoretical Assumptions which Underlay that Response," 1956. Draft and final typescript copies

Intercollegian, 1956 Oct. Correspondence, news release, memoranda, background material on the 1956 election, and a typescript copy of an article written by Reinhold Niebuhr for this issue, which was edited by E. Lefever
Ethics and U.S. Foreign Policy, 1957. Multiple drafts, correspondence, and miscellany, 1956-1958
The World Crisis and American Responsiblity: Essays by Reinhold Niebuhr, edited by Ernest Lefever, 1958. Correspondence, outlines and miscellany, 1956-1959
Arms and Arms Control, edited by Ernest Lefever, 1962. Correspondence, introduction, outlines and miscellany, 1961

"National Armaments and International Force," Institute for Defense Analysis, International Studies Division report (with others), 1963 July. Letters, interviews with U.S. military officials, notes, miscellaneous materials relating to trips, mimeographed report (4 vols.)
"The Dilemma of Limited Options," 1963 Sept. Outlines and clippings, primarily relating to the Cuban missile crisis
Crisis in the Congo, 1965. Promotional material and research records, 1963-1969
Speeches and writings relating to the Congo. Typescript and mimeographed copies, 1965-1971
United Nations Peacekeeping in the Congo, 1960-1964: An Analysis of Political, Executive and Military Control, U.S. Arms Control and Disarmament Agency report (with Wynfred Joshua), 1966
Katanga problem. Interviews, notes, printed materials, letters, reports, 1962-1965
Europe-North Africa trip, 1965 June-July. Correspondence and trip report
"Role of Indigenous Military in Developing Countries," 1966-1970. Multiple drafts, correspondence, and an outline
Uncertain Mandate: Politics of the U.N. Congo Operation, 1967. Letters, promotional material, reviews, and typescript
"The Limits of U.N. Intervention in the Third World," Review of Politics, 1968. Reprint and outline
"Orientation of A.I.D. Trainees at the Washington International Center," 1968 Oct. Mimeographed report
"The Congo: Crisis of Decolonization--1960-1961," in William G. Andrews (ed.), International Crises: Four Case Studies, 1970. Correspondence and typescript, 1968-1970

unittitle.title: Spear and Scepter: Army, Policy and Politics in Tropical Africa,

did.unittitle: General. Primarily lecture materials derived from the book; includes a book review, outlines, clippings, correspondence, a bibliography, and a condensed article published by the Brookings Institute
Correspondence with the Defense Department and William Gutteridge
Photographs. Clippings. SEE ALSO: Photo card file
"Profile of the Critical Foreigner," 1969 April. Schedule, book review, clippings and a letter, 1967-1970
"Impact of Military Assistance on Developing Countries," 1971 Jan. Speech transcript
"Defense and Development: Resource Competitors," 1972 March. Outline
"Aspects of U.S. Military and Public Safety Assistance," 1972 Dec. Outline, notes, memorandum, report and printed article, 1972-1973
"U.S. Public Safety Assistance: An Assessment," U.S. Agency for International Development report, 1973
"The CIA and American Foreign Policy," Lugano Review, 1975. Background materials and photocopy of the article
"A Two-Edged Sword? U.S. Military Training and Advice in the Third World," 1976. Preliminary draft
"A Two-Edged Sword? U.S. Military Training and Advice in the Third World," 1976. Drafts, comments and letters
"The Military Training Assistance Program," Annals of the American Academy, 1976 March. Printed copy, charts, and an outline
Nuclear Arms in the Third World: U.S. Policy Dilemma, 1977. Outline and draft chapters 1 and 3

Nuclear Arms in the Third World: U.S. Policy Dilemma, 1977. Draft chapters 5-8, bibliography, appendices, final draft; also includes a later draft prepared for re-publication by the Ethics and Public Policy Center (?), 1977-1987
Amsterdam to Nairobi: The World Council of Churches and the Third World, 1979. Drafts, proofs, a printed copy and correspondence
Will Capitalism Survive? edited by Ernest Lefever, 1979. Draft and printed copy
The CIA and the American Ethic, 1980. Preliminary materials, draft chapters 1-2
The CIA and the American Ethic, 1980. Draft chapters 3-5 and appendices, printed copy, and letters, 1975-1980
"Space Defense is a Shield, Not a Sword," 1983. Drafts and clippings
Scholars, Dollars and Public Policy: New Frontiers in Corporate Giving (with Raymond English and Robert L. Schuettinger), 1983. Printed article
"Nairobi to Vancouver: The World Council of Churches and World Politics," 1987 June. Typescript
Increment, 1989 Dec. Correspondence, typescripts, printed material and miscellany, 1949-1987
Increment, 1990 Dec. Manuscript copy of Lefever's memoirs, and research papers relating to theology. Notes, outlines, typescripts, and printed material, 1943-1990
FOREIGN AFFAIRS STAFF, OFFICE OF SENATOR HUBERT H. HUMPHREY, 1959-1960
General. Primarily work done by Ernest W. Lefever, with some biographical and administrative material relating to Hubert Humphrey
Letters drafted by E.W. Lefever for Sen. Humphrey
Letters between E.W. Lefever and Sen. Humphrey
Speeches and writings. Background materials, drafts and letters relating to work done by E.W. Lefever for Sen. Humphrey
Relations with the U.S.S.R. and military matters
Dodd, Sen. Thomas J., statements and positions
Maryland. Reports, minutes, letters, pamphlet and miscellany relating to the Values Education Commission and the Social Studies Project, 1979-1983
General Primarily printed reports and articles, 1974-1977
Council on Religion in Higher Education
Labor and Religious Associates of the National Citizens Political Action Committee
General. Printed and non-printed reports, memoranda, notes, clippings, newsletters, book lists, charts, and letters, 1980-1983
Advisory Committee on Ethical Values. Letters, minutes and miscellany, 1982-1983
Advisory Committee on Policy Organizations. Letters, clippings, agenda and minutes, 1981-1982
Advisory Committee on Public Policy Foundations. Letters, memoranda, minutes and agenda, 1981-1983
Latin American Assistant Secretaries of State

German prisoners of war. Correspondence, reports, minutes, memoranda, clippings, pamphlets, and other printed matter relating to YMCA participation in rehabilitation efforts in Germany after the war, 1946-1948

Pacifism - United States. Correspondence, reports, and memoranda relating to the activities of American religious pacifist groups during the war, especially in work camps, 1939-1948. Includes material relating to the American Friends Service Commitee, the Church of the Brethern, and the Fellowship of Reconciliation
General. Primarily administrative material. Letters, clipping, memoranda, notes, flyer and miscellany, 1982-1987
General. Schedules, flyers, notes, speech transcripts by Ronald Reagan and others, and miscellany, 1982-1987

Salute to Lech Walesa dinner, 1983 Oct. Correspondence with Edwin Meese, Caspar Weinberger, Max Kampelman, Lech Walesa and others, memoranda, schedules, lists, press releases, notes and miscellany, 1983-1986
Tenth Anniversay dinner, 1986 Nov. Speeches, list, and clippings, 1986
General. Catalog and correspondence with prospective publishers, 1974-1987
Kraemer, Sven, "The Soviet Intelligence War," 1979 March. Typescript
Bethell, Tom, "The New York Times," 1979 April
Benestad, J. Brian, "The Pursuit of a Just Social Order: The Policy Statements of the United States Catholic Bishops, 1966-1980," 1979-1980. Two drafts and a memorandum
Benestad, J. Brian, "The Pursuit of a Just Social Order"
Potter, Gary (ed.), "Pope John Paul II and Revolution," 1982. Typescript drafts, memoranda, printed and non-printed background material and reports
Potter, Gary "Pope John Paul II and Revolution"
Hitchcock, James, "The Jesuits," 1980. Typescript, correspondence, reviews, clippings and miscellany
Lefever, Ernest W. (ed.), "Reinvigorating Our Schools: A Challenge to Parents, Teachers and Policymakers," 1985 April. Excerpts from speeches by William J. Bennett, Ronald Reagan, and Ernest Lefever
General. News, Reviews and Comments on the Ethics and Public Policy Center. Clipping collection series
Handleman, Howard, KGB Activities in the United States, n.d. Edited copy
Herz, Martin F., How the Cold War is Taught, 1978. Edited typescript and printed copy
Kennan, George (ed.), Decline of the West?, 1978. Edited typescript, printed copy, and letter
Novak, Michael, Values in an American Government Textbook, 1978. Edited typescript and printed copy
Berman, Ronald (ed.), Solzhenitsyn at Harvard, 1980. Edited typescript and printed copy
Herz, Martin F., The Prestige Press and the Christmas Bombing, 1972: Images and Reality in Viet Nam, 1980. Edited transcript and printed copy
Griffith, Carol F. (ed.), Christianity and Politics: Catholic and Protestant Perspectives, 1981. Edited transcript and printed copy
Hessen, Robert (ed.), Does Big Business Rule America? 1981. Edited transcript and printed copy
Ramsey, James B., The Oil Muddle: Control vs. Competition, 1981. Edited transcript and printed copy
Seabury, Paul, America's Stake in the Pacific, 1981. Edited transcript and printed copy
Friedman, Murray, The Utopian Dilemma: American Judaism and Public Policy, 1985. Typescript

Increment, 1989 June. Correspondence, writings, reports, minutes, appointment books, calendars, and printed matter, relating to the Ethics and Public Policy Center and its conferences or reports on the PLO, Taiwan, and the World Council of Churches

Increment, 1989 Dec. Correspondence, memoranda, schedules, conference material, press releases, typescripts, printed reports, notes, and printed material. Includes material relating to nuclear weapons, religion, Russia, Cambodia, Africa, and the Ethics and Public Policy Center, 1949-1989
Increment, 1990 Dec. Correspondence, typescripts, press releases, and printed material, 1979-1989. Relates to evangelism in America

Increment, 1991 July. Correspondence, writings, memoranda, reports, class notes, and videotapes, 1937-1990. Relates to the Ethics and Public Policy Center, religious studies and ethics, and American pacifism during World War II, including the rehabilitation of German prisoners of war in Europe

scopecontent.p: Formerly security-classified records of the U.S. government. Arranged chronologically by date of release by Hoover
